Reviews.Title: “Shame about the details”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Husa Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff good - however the pool is almost imposible to find, The doors to the rooms do not fit properly nearly all on floor eight catch on the frame as they close making a bang at night, I requested an iron the one i was given (number 6) was in a dangerous condition with the negative wire exposed to the metal core. Final insult paying for wifi - What are they thinking about this is the only husa of the nine i stayed in that had the cheek to charge - we didnt play that game and went to starbucks next door for breakfast and free wifi soi they lost out twice!!c

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel away from the City Centre”
Reviews.Author: CyrilSmith
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the end of August to celebrate my birthday. Upon check-in we were met by the obligatory miserable desk person. Every Spanish hotel we have ever been to has one. Luckily everybody else at the hotel was very amiable. We had a very nice room 724. The view was uninspiring but we did not pay for that. As you entered there was a separate anti-room with the wardrobe and safe. This led off to the bathroom and bedroom. The bedroom was huge but unfortunately the bed was not but it was comfortable. A major bonus was that the A/C worked without the room key inserted for the lights to work meaning you could leave it on all day. The bathroom was also large with a bath/shower and a separate area for the w/c and bidet. Every day the room was spotless when we returned after a day out so top marks for the maids. Breakfast was included in the rate which is quite rare for Madrid. Most hotels we looked at were room only. On the first day we made the mistake of hitting the buffet at the same time as a tour party that were leaving that day. It was utter chaos but after they left if was fine. There was quite a variety but the standard could have been slightly better. There was a choice of cereals, pastries and toast and then the hot and cold buffet. There was everything from fried and scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and fried potato to cold ham and cheese and even salad, carrots, broad beans and chips. Coffee and tea were self service from a machine and usually one of the two machines was partially out of action. There was also a choice of fruit juice as well. Wi-Fi is not included for free and was a bit expensive. It was something like 5 Euros for an hour or 8 Euros for the day. We also wanted to use the computers in the lobby and were quoted 8 Euros even though we only wanted to use it for 10 minutes. That was the rate for 24 hours with no option for less. Even though the hotel is away from the centre it is only a few minutes walk to Plaza Espana and Parc del Oeste. There is not a huge range of eateries nearby but a 10 minute Metro ride away is Puerta del Sol giving access to Plaza Mayor. Also, next door is a supermarket and food court for any snacks and drinks and the department store of El Corte Ingles. Access to the hotel is brilliant with the Arguelles Metro station literally a two minute walk away. This gives you access to lines 3,4 and 6 which cover most of the city centre. It also gives you access to the airport with a change onto line 8 from either line 4 or 6. Personally I would recommend line 4 with a change onto the airport line 8 at Mar de Cristal. The other line 6 involves a long walk at the interchange station Nuevos Ministerios. It is maybe quicker in the long run but not when you are carrying luggage. Also remember to buy the airport supplement ticket when buying your subway ticket. Without this you cannot get into the airport. It is an additional 3 Euros each on top of the 1.80 Euros for the Metro but still cheaper than the rip-off taxi's. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon with no traffic and it cost 36 Euros. Overall a very nice and certainly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with a Great Rate !”
Reviews.Author: POONAWAT
Reviews.Content: Centrally located hotel in Madrid from a business and leisure perspective . Value for money Rate for a room per night ....with a wholesome breakfast . Definitely recommend it in the 4* category for Individual travellers as well as Incentive groups .

Reviews.Title: “Great Madrid experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Husa Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in one of Madrid's best sections (Arguelles), and next to a Corte Ingles department store. Good service at the desk, cleaning staff, and waiters at the breakfast room and at the restaurant. Very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Really good stay”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeTourists
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Husa for a business conference. My room, 312, was spacious clean, and , given the 40 degree heat, beautifully cool. The staff were helpful and knowledgeable. Most spoke good English. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the Plaza Major & the royal palace, but you can also grab a taxi from the hotel's rank. The food was better than average hotel fare.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 5 star!!”
Reviews.Author: Suzy Z
Reviews.Content: January 2012 - our first time at this hotel was great! Hotel was easy to find, staff were really welcoming, room was large and quiet considering it was overlooking a main street. We booked breakfast which was okay, but not worth the money! The late night bar is definitely a rip off!! Wouldn´t recommend that at all!! However we stayed again in March 2012 and it was a completely different story. Staff were far too busy to be welcoming. Our room was much smaller and for 2 nights we didn´t sleep properly because of the noise in other rooms and in the corridors. The first night I rang room service and asked for extra pillows as we had done the last time, but none arrived as they said they were short staffed and we wouldn´t get them until the morning. Not the sort of service you would expect from a 5 star hotel - which really it is not!! When we checked out the reception hall was jammed packed with delegates maybe 100 of them!! However give them their due, they did realise that we wanted to check-out and did so as quickly as they could. Not sure if we will stay there again - if we do it will be for the location and nothing else!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Armental
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel for two nights. The location is good. Easy commute to the airport, very close to Arguelles Metro which is two steps away from Puerta del Sol and El Corte Ingles is next door. Rooms are quite big and clean and the service was good. We found it a bit expensive for what they offer but in general the experience was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel: not bad, but not wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: AMRSA
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at the hotel & had a pretty good experience. The hotel is very close to the metro, El Corte Ingles and a Starbucks! The room was spacious and clean enough. It was a little outdated, but overall it was fine. I cannot comment on the value of the hotel as the stay was organized through work and I did not pay or even see the cost. Overall, it was an average stay. I wouldn't object to staying here again, but there are probably far better hotels in the city so I would definitely try another place next time....

Reviews.Title: “Rip off! Stay away..”
Reviews.Author: Jerome C
Reviews.Content: Very deceiving website with nice pics, but the facilities are poor! The pool and gym are not the hotel's but they are a separate exercise centre in which the hotel shares. Couldnt use the pool as there were seniors having water aerobics classes. Pool is a small indoor pool- should be an outdoors pool as its so hot in Madrid for a good part of the year. Had to pay 7.50 euro for 24 hr access internet when it's supposed to be free like most places. Hired a car to make things easier for us but hotel charges 22 euros per day for parking. Two single beds dubbed together to make a king which is ridiculous. . Also carpets has stains in a few distinct areas. Holiday inn would be a better choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: tesoroSpain
Reviews.Content: For the times when you want a no-hassle hotel in a big city the HUSA Princesa is fine. I choose this hotel because we wanted to be near the universities and dorms. The staff was accommodating: we arrive before 10 am and just wanted to drop our bag in the luggage room, but we were immediately checked in which we greatly appreciated. Our room was clean & large, sheets were crisp, bathroom was more than adequate. I liked the idea of the paintings from the Prado Museum as large headboards. It was so hot the day we were there that we had the menu del día at the hotel restaurant. It was a bit price and the food was fair, but at least we were out of the torrid heat. The breakfast buffet was good. The hotel is very accessible via metro and the shopping around the hotel is great with a large Corte Inglés next door as well as Zara, Massimo Dutti, etc. Will try this hotel again if I need to stay in the same part of Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: amz1986
Reviews.Content: Never seen such a vast selection of food and drink for breakfast. They really had everything. Was topped up regularly too. Waiting staff fantastic and very attentive. Gym and pool were very busy every time we went down there but still a nice extra. Good location and next to lovely department store Our stay only spoiled by the poor weather in may - would definitely come back here in August Rooms massive and thoroughly cleaned daily Food in restaurant quite expensive Reception staff very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IrishSel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst in Madrid for business. Negatives first: Checking into the hotel was just ok - I had a few issues with staff not understanding my English! I got one of the new room which was lovely. However, I had to go back to reception to collect my wi-fi password which wasn't given to me on check in. Turns out wifi doesn't work in the new part of the hotel so after a visit from an engineer I was moved to another room. My second room was in the old part of the hotel - this all took about 40 mins. The room was fine, but not anywhere as nice as the other one - so always ask to stay in the new part. One issue in my second room was that the toilet was making lots of noise - constantly filling up with water, but I couldn't be bothered to move again so I didn't say anything. I also had to wait for over 10 minutes to get seated for breakfast which is not ideal when you are on business and need to get in and our in a hurry. Location is great with a department store right next door and a huge Zara a few doors down. The hotel is right on one of the main streets in Madrid so you will be well placed to find your way around the city. The rooms are huge with great big comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: paulmmcevoy
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Nice spacious clean room. Staff at reception were very friendly and put us on top floor of 14 will led to lovely views. Good metro service nearby if needed.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent Hotel, first class”
Reviews.Author: LillyBlossom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 26th - 29th May 2012 with my eldest son and we had a fantastic time. We booked two rooms expecting quite small ones for single occupancy but they were superb, spacious and luxurious room which they still classes as 'standard'! Rooms 661 and 663 (ask for rooms in the newly refurbished part) The rooms are the most spacious I've ever stayed in. The bathrooms were marble with top quality fittings, toiletries and thick white towels. The main bedrooms both had seating areas, my son in 663 had a corner lounge sofa! Both had excellent tv, coffee making facilites and the biggest single beds I've ever slept in. The reception in the hotel was spotlessly clean (as was all the hotel) with friendly staff and elegant fixtures. Although we didn't eat at the hotel the bars, cafe and restaurant looked just as high quality. There are so many excellent restaurants and bars nearby you have to try them out. My son used the gym which is well equipped and found it to be really good, although we didn't use the pool there were a few people in it with children who seemed to be having a great time. The hotel is next to Arguelles metro station (across a road), has a 'Starbucks' a couple of shops away if you can't do without it! and a huge department store with pharmacy, supermarket and 5 floors of clothes and household shopping joining the hotel (el Corte Ingles). I found it an enjoyable 10 minute walk to the centre of Madrid or 5mins to Park Ouest. It took us about 20 mins on the metro from the airport with one change and cost 4.50 euro each single. As we were there for 4 days we bought a 3 day metro pass for 17 euro's zone A which covered everywhere we wanted to visit and well worth the money. Madrid is great to walk around and you can see more by walking but the metro is quick and easy and the trains are new. I would recommend rowing a boat on the lake at Park Retiro, The sunday flea market at El Rastro, the Palace which is stunning and strolling around Chueca. Opera has a great atmosphere for meals out at night. You can see most of the centre in a couple of days and if you enjoy walking you'll see even more. We also took a ride on the telerifique cable cars. I would recommend this hotel without question and hope you like it too.

Reviews.Title: “No wifi, no phones, no fridge, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: martha e
Reviews.Content: Our group of students was placed in a noisy, under construction part of the hotel, with no wifi, no phone service and no fridge access. The staff was so busy, they could not have cared less. The hotel is a great location, but not worth the money charged.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean hotel, good location, good service, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: aniyafa
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It has everything as well as great service, and a good location. Friendly staff, and lovely rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Ample rooms and well located. Wifi not included”
Reviews.Author: NH_80_LGW
Reviews.Content: I was given a massive room in the second room facing to the back of the hotel Husa Princesa. The room was very spacious and so were the bathroom and dressing area. Sleep quality was great as bed was nice and comfortable and I didn't hear any noises -I'm a light sleeper-. The TV had a few options to navigate (pay per view movies, hotel offers, etc) before you could get to the actual tv and radio channels, but worked fine. There was a towel “to use in the gym” as per the note left with it, in the closet. No idea where the gym was or whether the usage was included in the price or not. The room looked a bit dated and the carpet had a few stains but the size and comfort of the room made up for it. The A/C was quite basic (only 3 temperature settings) but worked fine for me. Breakfast was varied (cold meats, fruits, cereals, croissants, etc) and very good quality. They even had a diet section with a few choices-other places tend to keep only one or two products while Husa Princesa seemed to have quite a few options. Location is fabulous for visiting city centre (Plaza Mayor is about 25 min walk, Gran Via is about 10 min walk). The hotel has a subway stop around the corner, by the shopping centre (El Corte Ingles, simmilar to Macy's if you are visiting from US or to John Lewis if you are visiting from UK). Walking at night felt very safe. Fabulous location for business travellers attending any meetings along the A-6 and wanting to spend the night in Madrid There are two things that would have made the stay more pleasant: 1) Wifi was not free (even for the first hour). For a hotel of this category, I would expect the wifi to be included for free with the room. There are other hotels in the area of the same category with free wifi so I found quite surprising that it wasn't included in the room price. 2) The check-out process was extremely slow. They seemed to take ages with each customer checking out so I had to queue for about 10 minutes with no one in front of me. At some point 2 of the receptionists had no customers to serve but they seemed more pre-occupied on checking their files and making phone calls than on serving people waiting to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but well located”
Reviews.Author: luc t
Reviews.Content: Husa princesa is an average hotel well located. If you like to walk like me it is great location. Rooms are yet noisy as the street is quite crowded. From my perspective it is not a family hotel and if you are planning to stay in Madrid for few days it will be ok. This is especially true if you have meeting in pozuello or aravaca which are 15 minutes by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Beware rooms without telephone or wifi”
Reviews.Author: stevenp777
Reviews.Content: BEWARE OF THIS HOTEL. I arrived late & got a big new room..but with no telephone or wifi. Complained & was told "sorry." They had oversold & moved me into a new room (no phone or wifi) with construction noise in morning....I book via hotel.com to avoid this basic lack of giving what is promised - what happened? Tried to make SKYPE calls in lobby & far too noisy. Missed many important business calls that cost me $$$. Had to go to cafe instead of getting room service. Had to repack everything & move next day to old tower (took over 1 hour pack move & unpack). Rejected first old, dark small room they offered. Got larger old big room with stained carpets but with view & large windows. To be 100% fair…Hotel has GREAT location with subway & large stores nearby. Very nice overworked staff. 24 hour restaurant (unusual in Madrid). Access to large health club. Once all the hotel is upgraded & all rooms offer basic promises this will be awesome hotel. In meantime they CANNOT be allowed by hotels.com to give guests rooms that are not ready to be occupied w/o basic advertised necessities. I handle revenue management & distribution for major hotel group & know Expedia/hotel.com warns properties not to do this type of thing. NO one should be given a room with no phone & wifi when they are advertised – period. Consumers must speak up to keep hotels from being able to get away with this. BEWARE OF THIS HOTEL until they get their act together!!

Reviews.Title: “My Visit to Madrid Spain”
Reviews.Author: binuprasad
Reviews.Content: very Good hotel, good breakfast, very big rooms, centrally located in the city.

Reviews.Title: “amazing place at madrid with one of the largest rooms in europe”
Reviews.Author: royvm1
Reviews.Content: husa princesa, madrid is superb place... superb location...amazing staff... and great room. its so large that most of the other so called premium brands would have made 3 rooms out of husa princess's 1 room. congrats!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: stefmh
Reviews.Content: Husa Princesa is located in a perfect spot, very close to the subway station and to the centre.You can easily walk from there and reach shops, restaurants and attractions. I stayed there for business and had really nothing to complain about. Big rooms, huge beds. I'd like to come back there to spend a nice and romantic weekend in Madrid too.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Allen T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the subway tube... Close to attractions and VERY Close to some amazing food... front desk was helpful... We spent only one night there but it was a comfortable place... Location is the main draw here... nothing else is fancy....

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large rooms.”
Reviews.Author: bobbulo
Reviews.Content: Been here at the husa now for almost a month. A long time, I know. Benefits: Location - Close to the centre of Madrid. Next to shops. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Rooms - Clean, large and comfortable. The rooms I've been in have a large bed as well as a sofa (which converts into a bed - for those with children). There's also a decent sized desk for working/laptop. Internet connectivity is via wifi but is not free. Was able to have decent quality skype video calls for long durations. Room service: Fairly limited and got boring quite quickly. However, you can call at any time. So that's good especially when you're hungry. Gym: The gym is a multi-use facility in that it is not just for hotel guests. There are more non-guests at the gym than hotel guests. The pool is quite small. Food: Reasonable but a bit on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!”
Reviews.Author: kiwikwee
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location! Very nice room with massive beds and nice decoration. Room service is pretty expensive but includes caviar, so as to be expected! Went to aqua aerobics in the pool -in Spanish of course but we got the gist ;) The room was cleaned literally everytime we left it (3-4 times a day), with new toothbrushes and everything! Food in the restaurant was a bit bland but the you're right in the city. (stayed here in Feb 2009)

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: 3355Anna
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently situated for exploring the city, not just in the center but within walking distance from him. Rooms comfortable. Room service is good. The hotel has a fitness center and swimming pool (not very large), which is nice after walking around the city. Staff are friendly, no complaints there.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than average but think about location”
Reviews.Author: Lanie54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the hotel as part of a conference he was attending. Although the property is an older one, we were very pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. It was very large, with room for two desk areas (well, one is really a make-up spot for ladies, I guess) and a small sofa and coffee table. We were on the 14th floor with a huge window overlooking the northwest of the city -- very light, bright, and spacious. The room was in good condition, a few spots on the carpet and a few dings on the wall, but not bad. The bathroom was nicely done and in good condition as well. We were very comfortable there - and it was very quiet in the hallways (maybe the hotel wasn't full in February?) The lobby staff and the women checking us in at breakfast were very friendly. The breakfast buffet is excellent and everything was full regardless of the time we arrived. (It might be nice if the breakfast waiters smiled occasionally, but it didn't really matter.) The breakfast room feels like a conference room turned into a buffet; the decor could be a little more attractive, but that doesn't take away from a very complete and delicious breakfast. Wifi in the room worked well at a modest cost (even if it should be free!) and when we did have a problem, the hotel staff resolved it promptly. The immediate neighborhood has a handy Starbucks and an El Corte Ingles, including a fabulous supermarket in the basement (very handy!). There are a number of restaurants within a 10 minute walk, but they're not as obvious as in other parts of the city. In fact, location is the only reason I wouldn't stay here again. I love to walk in cities and be able to do my sightseeing on foot. This hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the Palace, 30 min to Plaza Mayor, 45 min to the Thyssen or Prado Museums. I enjoyed the walk, but not everyone would and it did feel like we were out of the way of the main action in the city. If it's your first time in Madrid, you might want to choose something more central .

Reviews.Title: “Worth a look”
Reviews.Author: PandS_L0ND0N
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Stayed here on a short business trip and found the bedroom large, plenty of space to work in, bathroom clean and staff helpful. The meeting rooms were well maintained and coffee/water replenished regularly. Good selection of dishes at breakfast, both hot and cold. Room service was quick and the Club sandwich great. The hotel is near the metro and it is possible to travel direct from the airport. A taxi from the airport was around 35 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Muy recomendable”
Reviews.Author: dise��adora
Reviews.Content: Hotel muy recomendable, excelente servicio, cerca del metro. La habitacion era amplia y comoda, las camas muy comodas, hay habitaciones remodeladas, la primera vez que estuvimos nos toco una sin remodelar que tambien era muy aceptable. Volveria otra vez, definitivamente. Los empleados del hotel fueron muy atentos con nosotros.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holiday240
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel in a nice area of Madrid.close to shops and metro stations Rooms to a high standard and very large.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: Mandy R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely located - only a block from a metro station and a main department/grocery store. The breakfast is fantastic and is enough food to make you full for the entire day. The service could be a little better but was okay. The rooms were really comfortable and clean with excellent cleaning service.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid, Spain”
Reviews.Author: Skygirl767
Reviews.Content: The Husa Princesa is a fabulous hotel. The location is perfect, lots to do around here, the metro is around the corner. Corte Ingles which is a large department store is next door where you can shop for anything and everything including groceries. The hotel itself is extremely clean, updated and has all amenities you will need. The staff is friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable of the city and what it has to offer. The beds are comfortable, always a great night sleep here. The food in the restaurant is among the best in the city. Lots of restaurants within walking distance, shopping, theater, transportation for day trips. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful they overcharge for the mini-bar”
Reviews.Author: JanetteAF
Reviews.Content: This accomodation was reccomended by a Spanish friend. It is a good deal for the money, the neighborhood seems pretty safe to walk through, even at night; the lobby is very modern, the rooms are very large and they were clean, but the hotel staff was aloof for an American's taste and pushy with women. They charged us for items we did not use from the mini-bar; two days in a row; same amount each day. After speaking with them they removed the charges, but I had the impression that this was a regular occurance. If you go be prepared to deal with that cultural shift and check your hotel bill carefully. This hotel is also a long walk to the tourist centers. We were in Spain on business and like to walk so this was not a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it - would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeFod
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location which allowed us to explore the city. Price was very good compared with other like and pretty much same location hotels and included a good breakfeast. Staff were very friendly, from the cleaners, to the dining room staff, to the reception staff though special mention to the dining room and bar staff who were outstandingingly friendly and helpful and clearly love children. Taxi from the airport is circa 40 Euro's which is not too bad when there are a few of you (We travelled as a family - one 2 year old and one 6 year old) and found the hotel ideal for us. The room was large enough for us all to sleep comfortably (and for the kids to play). The gym is very good but be aware that the pool does not allow children under 7 in during the week. Overall we enjoyed our stay and for the ladies out there it's very close (10 seconds) from a very large shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: yvrkids
Reviews.Content: A very, very good deal, though not in the most frenetically touristy part of town, close enough to everything and accessible to transit to make it worthwhile, especially given the value. Clean, functional, but as in other hotels in Spain and Portugal, the internet access is just painfully, painfully slow. Getting off at the airport, save yourself the 40 Euro cab fare and take the metro to Arguelles (just 1 train change), which is just steps away from the rear entrance of the Husa Princesa.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a base to explore the City”
Reviews.Author: Shakes1978
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a good location for exploring the City for our short City break. Room was really comfortable and we had loads of space, with great views of the City. The hotel has a good bar and a lovely outdoor terrace bar which was perfect for drinks before dinner. Hotel is right next to Arguelles metro station so really great for public transport access to the airport and the rest of the City. Would definitly consider staying here again if visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, well connected, not in the main tourist area”
Reviews.Author: fercho29
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel , specially if you are visiting Madrid for business, because it is not right in the crowded and noisy area of Downtown Madrid. Nevertheless, it has a subway station (Arguelles Station) right in the corner, so you can go anywhere around the city with no effort. It is a 15 minutes nice walk to the beginning of Gran Via if you like to walk. The neighborhood around is very nice and quiet, and tit is five blocks from Parque del Oeste, a beautiful park similar to the Central Park in NY, with a fantastic rose garden called La Rosaleda. The hotel is right above a big Cortes Ingles store where you can find electronics, clothes, furniture, etc, and it has a very good supermarket on the underground floor, with a great deli where we bought tasty salad, tapas and fish for dinner. There is a nice avenue bordering Parque del Oeste called Paseo Pintor Rosales with great restaurants and cafes with outdoor seating (May is great to eat outdoors in Madrid). If you have time visit Temple Dabod, an Egyptian temple that was rebuilt on a hill, with a great view to the Palacio Real as background; it is just 10 blocks away. Wi-Fi is not too expensive if you pay a 3 days pass (7 euros per day)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for shopping”
Reviews.Author: SueSilvers
Reviews.Content: I had a short business stay here this month and had a nice stay at this hotel. Located right next to a large el Corte Ingles, it's a good location if you need to do a bit of shopping while on business. The hotel could do with a refresh, the rooms and decor are a bit tired, but the hotel is perfectly clean and the staff is very accommodating. I hear they will refurbish soon...

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: junkbuzz
Reviews.Content: Not sure if I would rate as a 4star hotel, but it was all functional and good value. Check in was very slow, as were most requests at the front desk. Lots of staff but everything seemed to take a long time to complete. Business center was not complete, as hotel brochure said a scanner was available, but they did not have one. Lucky the hotel is close to a university so a print shop 2 blocks away had a scanner I could use to prepare for a meeting. Location good for moving around Madrid. Bit confusing to have rear and front entrances to some taxi drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Gym for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Monio_67
Reviews.Content: Few hotels in Madrid have gyms but this one has access to to a fitness club with an indoor lap pool. What a great benefit when you are away from home for weeks at a time in a big city. Will stay again just for the gym. Oh, only downside for business is the internet access. You have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Ana María
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights with my husband and this is the first time I stay in this part of Madrid and we didin´t regret. The hotel is perfect, very clean, with large rooms with sofa and great service. Metro station on the corner made easily going everywhere. You can walk to Plaza Espana and Gran Via, they are just a few blocks away. And for women specially, this hotel has a plus...beside the hotel there is a Corte Ingles (the most famous department store in Spain). Just a few blocks from the hotel you will find a little Plaza with restaurants like VIPS (very good and unexpensive) and 100 montaditos which I truly recommend (not a classic restaurant but delicious). I definitely return to this hotel, I really felt at home there.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient location”
Reviews.Author: ukitraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights and found that a pleasant place to be - really close to the Metro station, 10 minutes walking distance to Royal Palace, bus stops. We didn't order a a breakfast because it was cheaper to go to the Supermarket around the corner and we had a better choices of breakfast products ( we read reviews of breakfast option on Tripadvisor and decided not to take it). Bad thing is that at this age hotel doesn't offer a free Wi-Fi unlike a lot of other hotels. Coffemaker would be a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: Haz81
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel, great breakfast but on day two I was refused entry for breakfast because i was wearing fit flops (smarter than normal flip flops). The previous morning I wore the exact same thing and it was not a problem. I understand having a strict code for evening meals, but come on, for breakfast! As a result i didnt get my breakfast as it was going to be a quick one anyway has had a flight to catch and I didnt have time to go back to hotel room and unpack to get another pair of shoes out (my other shoes were trainers so they would probably be no good either!!). So no breakfast for me. So if your there for leisure, be warned, you have to wear your smart clothes to get served breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JOGAB53
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights. Check in and Check out was very fast. Location of the hotel is in the center and near the Royal palace. The staff is excellent. Hotel and rooms are clean. Breakfast is super. The hotel is next to El Corte Ingles. I will return back.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tor_Travel_Guy
Reviews.Content: Husa Princesa in Madrid was a fantastic hotel and I enjoyed staying there. The lobby is beautiful and the someone plays the piano in the evening hours. It’s a nice place to relax after dinner. The room was spectacular as I had a suite with a city view. The room was large with its own change room and bench. The bed was big and I liked the large artwork over the bed. The view of the city was fantastic but it would have been nice to see the city lit up in the night. The service was great as well but I would have expected that more people speak English for an International Hotel. The gym was big but open to the public as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mugur67
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Husa Princesa between 15 and 21 April.The hotel has a very good location, next to shopping area,very close to centre town.Nice rooms, friendly staff, very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable charm in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Lamppu
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a Saturday to Wednesday trip to Madrid. HUSA Princesa is well situated on the edge of the city center. Hm... I can think of no other way to describe the location, since it's in a lively district but just a short distance from Madrid Complutence University campus and the suburbs and empty spaces. The hotel is dated but very clean and well kept. The room was big, the beds on the hard side, which is better than too soft. The breakfast buffet is very nice with a great variety of meats, cheeses, eggs, fruit etc. Staff are friendly. Even thought the district is lively, the hotel is quiet enough. We had no complaints. - More expensive rooms may have more amenities, but our basic room was just fine for our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: tint7003
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel and felt it offered good value. It's very centrally located right by the Arguelles metro station and alongside a department store. My room was huge - you opened the door into an outer lobby and then through another door in to the bedroom. This meant there was no problem with corridor noise and I slept very well. The room offered all the usual amenities, although the furnishings were looking a little dated and the bathroom all the more so. This hotel has a very Spanish flavour which I liked and it also offers access to a very well-equipped gym. Staff were mostly helpful other than at reception. When I arrived there no other guests were in line and I counted 5 gentlemen working behind the desk all of whom studiously ignored me for several minutes. When I checked out the exact same thing happened - whatever they are working on behind that reception desk is apparently more important than attending to waiting guests. But this was the only negative in an otherwise very good stay and if you get lucky with the rate as I did then I'd thoroughly recommend this place for your stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money great location”
Reviews.Author: ballyliffin
Reviews.Content: i found this hotel to be amazing value and to be in a great location.the metro was located close by which could be used to access the airport and other parts of madrid.within walking distance you also have many shops,restaurants,theatres and muesums.i found my room to be large and clean with a fantastic bathroom.the staff were friendly and catered for all your needs.the hotel also had a gym and swimming pool!even though the gym is open to the public it was quite when i went and i found it to be very good.next time i return to madrid i will stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5* and not really recommended”
Reviews.Author: angiejm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our holiday and wished we'd returned to our original hotel (Best Western Atlantico) instead..... First the good points - the hotel is in an excellent location and the staff were friendly, polite and helpful. However, points were deducted for: tired room decor, unimaginative selection of complimentary toiletries, very expensive hotel bar, no hotel transport available for the airport. All in all we were disappointed and did not feel the hotel deserved it's 5* billing.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not 5 star, but very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: amdev
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here and got a great price through an agency. The hotel has an excellent location in the centre right next to a metro station and is therefore very convenient for the airport with only one change. There is a large foyer with a business centre, cafe and bar. The bar operates 24 hrs while the cafe serves good quality - if a little expensive- food until about 10.30. You have to pay for wifi which is annoying, but you can use the computers in the business centre to print your flight details/boarding passes for free - just ask at reception. The room are very spacious. As some commentators have already noted, they do lack the wow factor. The toiletries were also disappointing - combined shower gel/shampoo. There was a good choice of hot and cold food for breakfast and a nespresso coffee machine. I didn't try the fitness centre or gym, so can't comment. The staff were fine - no different for any other establishment in Madrid. overall, there was no 5 star wow factor, but that was expected due to the price. I paid €110 a night for 2 people including breakfast, so I got a lot more than I paid for

Reviews.Title: “"A lot to be desired for'"”
Reviews.Author: NadChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days. On the plus side the location is great, very close to attractions and to the subway. We liked the fact that it is connected to Ingles Cortes , a huge store with a food section in the basement which came in very handy for getting some reasonably priced beverages or snacks. Also, the rooms and bathrooms are really spacious and. the housekeeping staff was very accomodating. when we first got there , our oom was kind of "stuffy". i asked housekeeping to unlock the window so we could get some fresh air and they got to it right away. it made a world of difference to be able to open the window! On the negative side, the hotel is kind of dated, especially the lobby. Food was not that great : we ate once in the first floor restaurant and the food was tasted like some warmed up frozen diner. The front desk staff was ok but nothing that you would expect from a 4 or 5 stars hotel as they claim to be. When i tried to print my boarding pass in the lobby printer and found out the printer was out of ink, i asked the front desk if they could replace the cartridge and was told nothing could be done until Monday because "technical " help was not available on the week end...the other thing that was a disapointment is the so called "coffee maker" in the room: it consisted of instant coffee packets and a kettle to warm up water.. luckily there is a Starbucks right next to the hotel. If you plan to use the gym, be prepared to bring a towel and a bottle of water with you. The gym is crowded and filthy, located in a basement with terrible ventilation. It is open to the public and no one seems to wipe the equipment after they use it. Overall, this hotel has potential but lacks the anemities you would expect from a 4 or 5 stars hotel. Also, check your bill before you leave, they tried to charge me for the mini bar which i never used, but they got me on the phone charges: eventough i used my calling card for every local call i made , i was charged a sizable "connection" fee for each of the calls ...from approx. 3 Euros to 6 Euros for each local call! Overall , this hotel has potential but if you are expecting a 4 or 5 stars hotel experience , this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, well located, value for money”
Reviews.Author: eanDublin
Reviews.Content: Five star rating is evident in general ambience, comfort and large size of room albeit not in any added exras such as luxury goodies that one might expect in a five star hotel. Likewise restaurant is simple and lacks a five star feel. Leisure facilities whilst available are in an adjoining public fitness centre. Location of hotel is excellent - quiet neighbourhood - metro very nearby - within walking distance of city centre and many attractions - located beside a Cortes Ingles department store. Reception staff are friendly and helpful. Overall really good value for money - good deal availed of. Have stayed there before and would do so again.

Reviews.Title: “some less 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: robertGump
Reviews.Content: This very big hotel is not a 5 stars hotel in my opinion. They have a very large rooms, many facilities, perfect location (it's very close to GRAN VIA) but it's very old and unfortunately not well managed. Anyway the price is very chip.. maybe we can come back here. Absolutely I prefer the smaller hotels..

Reviews.Title: “great location, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: yo_panda
Reviews.Content: My experience of this hotel was very positive. While I don't think it's a five star hotel, certainly not from my experience of five star hotels, it is a good central four star hotel - not stylish and modern, but traditional and a bit dated. The rooms were very large and great for a long stay in the city, the gym was very good and had plenty of machines. The location was excellent, very central and next door to a major department store,supermarket and metro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tareq74
Reviews.Content: We have booked 4 double rooms at Husa Moncloa but we were transferred to the sister hotel Husa Princesa. We found Husa Princesa as an excellent hotel with great location. The rooms are large and comfortable with seating area, the staff are helpful, the breakfast is rich, and the location is excellent. The metro station is couple of steps away, and the hotel is few steps from the famous El Corte Ingles Shopping Mall and Supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “This is an afwul hotel”
Reviews.Author: Agnieszkaa
Reviews.Content: - Gym/ swimming pool is open for public!! - The hotel is outdated, it was probably nice about 30 years ago, everything is old and falling apart - It is not possible to adjust the airco in the room, it keeps blowing 24/7 so the room was freezing - Overall they should be happy with 2 stars (and that’s even much in my opinion)

Reviews.Title: “not even close to a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Afif_a4
Reviews.Content: the only good thing about this hotel is the location everything else is bad

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: travelleralamundo
Reviews.Content: First business trip to Madrid. Check in was a breeze, helpful friendly front desk staff. Typical European style breakfast, plentiful and good variety. The hotel is in close proximity to everything in Madrid and quite reasonably priced. Rooms are well appointed, with comfortable beds, spacious with good size work area. The bathrooms were above average and very clean. The only annoyance during my stay was a slight cigarette smoke smell in my non-smoking room. I couldn't quite figure out where it was coming from. It wasn't overwhelming but noticeable. The room was also a little stuffy at times with no ability to crack a window for some fresh air , windows were sealed shut. All in all a good stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel in Madrid......5*??”
Reviews.Author: MikePM
Reviews.Content: Ok, you advise...run away from this hotel, not only this is not even a 2* hotel, very old looking building next to the shopping mall the Cortes Ingles. Like most Hotel from the HUSA group the decoration and layout is really kitsch...smelly and outdated. First the front desk, very unprofessional 4 staff but only one paying attention no matter the queue. Cigarette smell all around, and no attention to detail whatsoever. The room are just OK for a budget hotel but not for a 5*. The sport facilities are very very dodgy (open to the public). The restaurant and breakfast is not worth a penny. So to conclude, this is just an awful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Anne-Marie_Marjan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel may look a bit old-fashioned however the room interior is fine. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Windows are closed for safety purposes but you can request to have them opened through the reception. We did not take breakfast as there are so many alternatives around the hotel. The hotel location is fine, metro stations nearby, large shopping streets close by and the Cortes Ingles shopping mall attached to the hotel with extended opening hours (on sunday the supermarket of Cortes Ingles is even opened). If you expect to have a nice bar in the restaurant to have a last drink prior to your sleep, you may be dissappointed as its a very lighted open area; you'd rather walk outside and find some better alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not 5*”
Reviews.Author: KermyR
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in strange location and we had to ask for directions in the El Corte Ingles department store. It was situated almost in the service area of the department store, next to a car park and looked a bit like a prison from the outside. We reliased that this was the side entrance and the main entrance was ok. The tube stop Arguelles was very close about a 1 minute walk away. The reception staff were helpful although they thought we were arriving for a conference as there were 8 of us and we nearly ended up joining in! I had requested rooms on high floors, near to each other and the hotel did arrange this for us. The rooms were a good size and had a lot of storage but some of our friends had problems with their heating as they couldn't control the temperature or speed. This was sorted out very quickly once reception had been contacted and was fixed in a few hours. The rooms were equipped with a good selection of toiletries and a safe, mini bar, magazines, extra pillows and blankets and a turn down service. We had breakfast included with the price and there was a reasonable range of food, probably not worth the full cost but if you get it included you may as well have it. We looked at the pool but there are not any directions showing you how to find it. Once arriving at the floor from the lift you open the door and find yourself in the middle of a gym. After squeezing past people working out we mananged to locate the pool and decided it was not worth using, due to the volume of people in the gym. It appears that the gym, pool etc are not exclusively for guests of the hotel and therefore the health club was constantly busy. We never used the restaurant or champagne bar but we did have a few drinks in the main bar and found the prices to be an average price for a hotel bar. About Madrid - we bought a 3 day travel card for the metro at the airport and used this to get around or walked everywhere. We made the mistake on our first day by walking into a bar for a drink and snack and let the waiter bring us out some food. Unfortunatly we should have asked for a menu as we ended up with about 14 dishes and a 300 euro bill after! Tourists are always warned to avoid central areas (Plaza Mayor) for this reason and we only have ourselves to blame for this.

Reviews.Title: “Forget about the 5 stars: a terrible experience.”
Reviews.Author: fedec65
Reviews.Content: If you think spending your nights in a 5 stars hotel, forget about it. I would grade it not more than a *** 3 star hotel. The service staff at this hotel is absolutely terrible. If you have some doubts the first impression at the front-desk will immediately show you how a 5 stars staff should not behave. A small example: I've asked the staff to print my boarding card out from an USB stick and they asked me 6 EURo (!): unbelievable. The rooms are good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position, good quality bedrooms but variable service”
Reviews.Author: servicechampion2
Reviews.Content: This hotel trades on its position. The bedrooms are fine and well equipped but I found the service not to be up to the 5 star standard it aspires to. Check-in was efficient rather than welcoming. The coffee in the coffee shop was very expensive and not good quality. The biggest let down was the buffet breakfast, served in a room that felt like a works canteen with staff who were not alert to the needs of the guests. It took some time for the internet connection to work, which was very frustrating given that I had work to complete. Room 223 was very noisy - just above the delivery point for the department store next door - woke me up at 4.45 am

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel fantastic value great location”
Reviews.Author: lilythepink06
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it worked out about £4 per night more expensive than a 3 star - mainly due to there being no extra charge to accomodate children in the room. Easy to get to (less than 2 blocks from the metro), walking distance of most of the tourist sites - or else a bus or metro trip away. Reception and front of house people were all helpful and accomodating (I find that people in Madrid can be a little brusque and are not happy smily people 24/7 but hey who is). Room was ok - still plenty of room after we made up the sofabed. Beds good - though not as good as Marriott beds. Bathroom ok - nothing wow but all ok. We didnt have much of a view - ie a concrete wall but it was very quiet. Breakfast very expensive 25E but we were given 50% off vouchers which made it almost good value as the buffet was extensive (ie smoked salmon, a dozen types of hams and salamis, lots of different cheese, freshly cooked eggs, bacon, fruit, muesli as well as cereal, etc etc). Facilities were good for a city centre hotel - use of gym and pool, etc internet access is a bit expensive (there is a vips round the corner that does it for half the price). Various restaurants and bars - none of which we tried mainly due to money but also due to time constraints. Clientele were a mix of English who had got a good price, airline staff, quite a few spanish families and a lot of American teenagers. (complete with braces) Overall I would recommend and possibly go back (depending on what else was available for a similar sort of price). I think 5 star is pushing it a bit (though the service was very good - but the chocolates on the turndown service were not that nice alas). but it is certainly a very good 4 star plus hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid75
Reviews.Content: I agree with previous reviewers that the 5 star rating is misleading, but as someone who travels a lot to Madrid on business, I really like this hotel. I've stayed there three times and always found the rooms very nice. Unlike another reviewer, I've never had a room with tired decor. It does have a kind of retro 1970s feel, but the rooms are large, have nice furnishings, usually with a small sofa which is really nice to relax on after a day working or sightseeing, a good desk to work at, good wardrobe space, large TV, mini-bar etc. I agree the breakfast is very expensive, although there's a huge selection of fruit, breads, hot food etc, unless you are very hungry it's not really worth it. The staff on the front desk but can be a bit hassled (although once when I turned up and discovered I'd only booked one night when I needed six nights, they were really good and sorted it out very quickly), but the other staff (in the bar, cleaning staff) I found really helpful and friendly. As also mentioned El Corte Ingles is right next door (including a huge supermarket in the basement which is convenient for snacks), which is very useful, Arguelles metro stop is also 1 minute walk away and there are numerous good tapa bars and restaurants in the vicinity (I particularly like Casa Marco just around the corner for good Italian food).

Reviews.Title: “It's OK but all the stars in its emblem are sheer misleading”
Reviews.Author: svensktiger
Reviews.Content: Forget about the 5 stars listed in the hotel's emblem, that's just misleading marketing. I would grade it for a regular *** 3 star hotel according to European standards. I like the hotel, the service is at the front-desk is OK but we got an overall messy impression. In the front-desk there's a sign proudly showing all airline mileage programs they are affiliated with. When I requested to have one my accounts credited, I was informed that only guests who have made reservations directly via a certain agency (Worldhotels?) were eligible for receiving points. Excuse me, but how many people do that? Further that was not possible to read out from the sign and I clearly made a point that the info given was undue and got the response: "well, it's our manager who have asked us to be restrictive with passing out points to guests, but we will credit your account." The rooms were perfectly cleaned. Didn't try the breakfast as it was not included in the rate. We went for a cup of coffee to a Starbucks just around the corner. El Corte Ingles is just next to the hotel too. The senior doormen are really helpful too. What I like best with this hotel is the gym facility! Guests of the Husa have free access to an adjacent gym featuring all kinds of machines and classes. It is a little bit crowded but that's for sure the best side of staying in the Husa Princesa. The rooms are good, but those rooms facing the street can be very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 day visit to Madrid with my 2 teenage children. The hotel was in an excellent location beside the metro which we used to explore the city. The rooms were very comfortable and we were very happy there. We hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Superior hotel in a desirable, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: maplehuggers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem in Madrid. It is suitable to business travellers or turists. Not the best option for a family with kids. It offers a luxury accomodation convenient to shopping ( right next to a El Corte Ingles store) and the downtown area at a walking distance ( 30 minutes) or via underground (Arguelles station) near the hotel. Extremely fairly priced for a 5 stars. Rooms are nice even if for a 5 star I would have expected a little more elegance. Nice linen towels with hotel embroidered monogram in the bathroom. Staff is extremely professional. I didn't try the restaurant but I had the room service which was average but good. I would gladly stay there again. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious & convenient”
Reviews.Author: SaldeanTripper
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Husa Princesa for 4 nights on a business/leisure trip. Overall, it was a clean and good quality hotel in a good location - more positive stuff later, after I've got my main gripe out of the way. Previous reviewers have commented on the welcome they have got from the reception desk staff, and I've never placed much emphasis on this really. However, on this occasion I did find it slightly irritating that the 'gaggle' of men behind the desk seem quite disinterested in my arrival (late evening) and appeared more motivated by the blokey chat they were having which I had interrupted. Once I'd checked in and found that the room had no iron (I wanted to iron my shirt for my meeting early next day) I visited by new friends on the reception desk. My request for an iron was met with a mix of bemusement and irritation. The housekeeper could provide me with an iron at 8.15 the next morning (my meeting was at 8am). The guy looked like he was pretending to call someone to get an iron delivered as a special favour but none ever arrived and I had to wear the same shirt two days running. Not five star service really. On to the positive stuff. The room was very big, clean and comfortable. Nice view to the NW of Madrid and beyond to the mountains. My wife flew out to join me for the weekend on day two and was impressed with the hotel. We didn't eat any meals here (too expensive & we wanted to eat out anyway). The location is good too. Near to good shops, very close to a well-connected Metro station or an interesting 20 minute walk from the centre of the city. Madrid was excellent & having a comfortable room in a nice hotel to rest in after a long day of intense tourism made our weekend there very enjoyable. Don't let the disinterested chaps on the reception desk put you off - the Husa Princesa is a good hotel & we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - great value”
Reviews.Author: wrightser
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located on Princesa Street. Very near to the metro station Arguelles (on line 3) just up the street. The facilities at the hotel are great for a city centre hotel and the rooms were very comfortable and well maintained. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Letustrade
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 08. Location is extremely good - away from the touristy spots yet close enough to the centre of action, subway and a big supermarket right beside the hotel, 5min walk to the double-deckle hop-on-hop-off bus, complimentary hotel pickup from all day tour operators. However, there is no good restaurant within 50m radius - fast food ftw! Staff are helpful. Spacious big rooms reminiscence of a 1970s 5* hotel. Room and furniture well maintained despite showing some signs of aging. Only downside is that the water pressure in the shower is despicably low - not sure if that's the case throughout Madrid. Good value for money if you book it through various websites. Very difficult to find another hotel of this calibre in or around Madrid's tourist's areas at this price. Some 4* and 3* hotels can be in quite noisy locations or poorly maintained. Other 5* hotels are further. Will I go back? If they promise to give me decent water pressure I will. If not, then just a maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploring Madrid”
Reviews.Author: jennydm
Reviews.Content: We booked the Husa Princesa for a long weekend trip to Madrid for our family of 5. Parents, 2 University students, one teenager. The rooms were lovely, and quiet - double glazing and with an inner door to stop noise from the corridor. Chose the hotel partly for the pool, but never even bothered to go and look at it. (too many other things to see and do) Expensive buffet breakfast we never fitted into our busy schedule, but the room service was excellent, and breakfast in the hotel good value. Staff were very friendly and helpful. It was a sufficiently luxurious venue, incredibly convenient - a few yards from Arguelles Metro station - and very Spanish. Just what we wanted. Great seafood restaurant - Compostela - just opposite. And a very authentic Spanish cafeteria next door. And El corte Ingles adjoins - their restaurant is a very authentic and good value dining experience. Love Madrid, love the hustle bustle, but quite nice to escape from it so easily at the end of the touring day. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, wouldn't rate it as a 5* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gtakiuk
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Madrid on 31st March for 3 nights, we took our 6 month old baby with us, I must say that Madrid is not a child friendly city, you could never find a baby chair anywhere, and baby changing facilities are only in El Corte Ingles, the department store! And people expect you to give them way with your buggy, and they would never stop and let you before them! I found it really difficult, and would not recommend it to families with young babies! The hotel too didn't have any high chairs, so my baby had to be strapped in his buggy during breakfast, or sitting on our laps! The room however is big, the bed is comfortable and we were provided with a cot, (Thank God!). I must say that they're quick with their services, we had some problems with the airconditioning, and within few seconds they were fixing it. Anything you want you'd get it within few minutes. The breakfast is good, varied, but the hotel is more for business people, not a family hotel, but the location is perfect, I cannot fault the hotel except I wouldn't give it a 5*, we stayed in far more better 5 star hotels, but maybe for Madird this is considered a 5 star. The hotel is connected to the department store El Corte Ingles, with a big supermarket in the basement and a pharmacy, it's very convenient for everyday needs, although you're provided with everything in the room, even a shaving gel with a razor! But remember to put the "Please do not disturb" sign everynight, as they will knock on the door at 11pm offering some chocolates! I must be very honest and say that I would not go back to Madrid again, people are very rough, they lack courtesy, not very friendly, can't speak english at all, well I don't expect them to be fluent, but to look blankly at me as I ordered Tea is a bit too much! I then had to say Te for them to understand! It was exteremly difficult with a baby, no bottle warming, no changing facilities, no high chairs, no consideration for you and no priorities given to us. In some occassions I found them to be very rude. There are many restaurants, but not so delicious! Everything is overpriced, found it more expensive than England. Apart from my comfortable stay at the hotel, I would definitely say that this was definitely my worst trip ever.

Reviews.Title: “beware exchange rate ripoff on checkout”
Reviews.Author: austbiztraveller
Reviews.Content: Beware this hotel ripping you off on exchange rates when you check out. I asked for my credit card charges to be in Euros so my bank will convert at their rate to my home currency. notwithstanding the request the hotel processed in my home currency and the conversion included a fee of 2.5%! I stay here regularly because the location is good and the rate is OK for their big rooms but I agree with previous users that the grumpy staff who work at the front desk do not make for a positive experience. I would be very wary of the exchange rate ripoff with other Husa hotels too. It looks like some dodgy arrangement they have with the bank who provides their credit card service.

Reviews.Title: “This is not hospitality”
Reviews.Author: runner123
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Husa Princesa as we attended a conference in Madrid. There were 4 old gentlemen at the Front desk upon arrival and no other guests but still they did not look at us or greet us. After a long while someone said "Just a moment" . These people should not work in a hotel. The room had a nice size with 2 desks but glasses were missing at the minibar. Told Front Office twice but never saw any glass. Ordered a bottle of white wine at room service but waiter had no corkscrew to open it. The air conditioning did not work and the windows could not be opened. Had a room at the back but there was no double glass so still noisy at night with someone saying things through a loudspeaker at regular times outside. An espresso at the lobby bar was was € 3,40. When we ordered one a 6.00 p.m. this was suddenly € 6.80. The waiter showed us the bar card where it was written: Minimum charge for consumptions after 5.00 p.m. is € 6.80. Very strange for a lobby bar without any entertainment. He could have told us this upon taking the order. The cashier upon checking out did not look at us and was busy on his computer. Only when he was ready after several minutes he took care of us. This is not an experience someone expects in a 5 star hotel. It seems that not only the staff is not interested in their guests but also the management does not know what "Customer driven"means by issuing strange policies.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel at 2 Star Prices”
Reviews.Author: HammerinHankMobley
Reviews.Content: Through a Spanish hotel web site we found a fantastic deal at this 5 star hotel in a great area. 47 euro per night. Steps from the subway, and the stop closest to the hotel is home to 3 different lines. You can get anywhere in Madrid in minutes. The restaurant was understandably expensive, but there were plenty of cheaper places steps away, or stops away on the subway. If you can get a similar deal, jump on it.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: jan0la
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Husa Princesa and had an enjoyable 3 night stay. Our room was very big and also had a settee that I think doubled as a bed. Even with this in our room there was still plenty of space. We had our bed covers turned down every evening and chocolates left on the side of our bed. The towels were changed twice a day and flowers left in a vase in our bathroom. The staff were helpful in making dinner reservation at restaurants of our choice and even got the directions for me. Although we arrived by taxi the metro is just yards away from this Hotel. It was within walking dstrance of the Cathedral and the Real Palace. The hotel itself was next door to the El Corte del Ingles which is a very large store quite like our John Lewis. We were able to get sandwiches from here. Breakfast at the Hotel was hot/cold buffet which we had included in our price and we made use of every morning. All in all we I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “great upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Chulolaw
Reviews.Content: booked a cheaper room at the moncloa next door and was upgraded b/c it was sold out. The princesa is beautiful, great location and awesome suite. I could never complain. Except, the internet service was 15 euro per night, unless you need the service continuously go to an internet cafe. Breakfast was 23 euro per person but you can eat cheaper outside. Buy your tickets to the madrid vision at the hotel it is 15 euro and well worth it. You can purchase ticket at lobby and they will direct you where you need to go to find bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, big beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: NJSJ
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was perfect. Rooms were large, bed comfortable and location was perfect. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, not cheap”
Reviews.Author: Recoleta
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, as you would expect for the price. Great location. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Toofaraway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Husa Princesa for two nights in September, 2007. Our room was located on the 14th floor and offerred a fantastic view of Madrid. The room was very attractive and comfortable. The hotel is well located in an area with many shops, restaurants, and a large department store within easy walking distance. We were very satisfied and had a most pleasant stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: ChicaVal
Reviews.Content: I paid for a bigger non smoking room, but this hotel gave me another room that was obviously smoked in. Also, upon check in, it was obvious that the clerk changed rooms seeing that I was not the right stuff. He did not realize that we dudes from the other side of the pond do understand the Castillian idiom. Also, at one time, we were seated at the bar area with friends along with a few local Spanish businessmen. We ordered the same bottle of white wine, but the bartender tried to sell us the older version. We kindly requested the same vintage as our Spanish colleages, and magically the newer and non- vinegar wine appeared. I have no answer for this except to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - very happy”
Reviews.Author: Knulpuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Princessa for two nights in July 2007. The positives were: - Clean, large room, with a view (10th floor) - Easy to locate from airport (via Metro), close to the town centre - Excellent breakfast - Courteous and efficient staff I would not say there were any negatives though if I paid the advertised rack rate of I think 345eur per night I would have not been so happy! Its a 5 star hotel which probably owes more to the high end business facilities and ticks in boxes rather than pure luxury. That said I would not hesitate to recommend it Cannot comment on any of the hotel ammenieties eg gym etc or on the bars / restuarants as we went elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't consider it to be either 4* or 5*”
Reviews.Author: logonmar
Reviews.Content: I selected the Husa Princesa on the basis of some tripadvisor.com reviews I had read and booked it in January '07 for 3 nights in May '07. As the reason my wife and I were going to Madrid was to celebrate our 25th anniversary I emailed the hotel to tell them this and to ask for a nice room. Their response stated 'WE´LL GIVE YOU A NICE ROOM.' From this response I honestly expected to something better than: a) A room with a view of a wall belonging to a major department store and their air conditioning units etc. b) The toilet seat in the en suite was cracked (hardly the most hygienic considering what toilets are used for?) c) A number of cracked floor tiles in both the bathroom and toilet areas and again these cracks cannot be hygienic situated where they are d) Soap dispenser over bath/shower remained empty for 2 days. e) Only one bedside lights had a working bulb. Was disappointed in fact that we chose this hotel. Staff on reception on arrival date were less than welcoming in manner however I must say the cleaning staff that did our room were excellent other than fact that they didn't replenish the shower soap dispenser. I had understood this hotel to be 4 star but all their signs state it to be 5 star. I personally have stayed in better 3 star establishments! Incidentally wasn't exactly cheap at approx €160 per night excluding breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: chrislleida
Reviews.Content: Like several other posting, on arriving at the Husa Moncloa, we were told that we had been upgraded to the Princesa so we were pleasantly surprised. Rooms clean well furnished, beds very comfortable, staff very pleasant and helpful and a good location. The hotel carpark gives reasonable rates (€26 per day) compared with commercial carparking. The only downside was that we were on the north side facing the Corte Ingles department store and there was a considerable amount of tooing and froing in the wee small hours with trucks delivering. Not a lot of noise. but the occasional "peep, peep, peep" of a truck reversing sounds too much like a (distant) alarm clock! Try to get rooms on the south- better views- or higher up.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel embedded in a department store”
Reviews.Author: alanreynolds
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights Friday 16 and Saturday 17 March 2007. It is located within the structure of a Cortes Ingles department store branch (which seem to be everywhere in Madrid!) alongside the Arguelles metro station. So location is a short walk only from the Royal Palace, but requires 2 changes on the metro to reach the airport (where the stop serves terminal TWO). There is a glossy, spacious entrance hall. On arrival, after an overnight flight from South America, I got into my room around 09.00. Good marks for that. Room 1211 was by the lifts but no background notice. Large double bed. Bathroom had a separate alcove for the WC and bidet but these could not be used independently of the bathroom itself. Breakfast was buffet style and adequate rather than sumptious (I have had more extensive ones elsewhere in Spain). I chose the hotel because it had a pool (unlike most in Madrid) but as it did not open until after breakfast on the Saturday, it was not practical to use it. There were two Internet terminals in the lobby area but I did not use these. The concierge was very efficient in booking a city bus tour, and found excellent restaurants for paella, and fish dinners. Check out early on the Sunday was slick. An enjoyable stay but given that the swimming pool is so difficult to access, I think I would choose somewhere nearer Place Colon next time.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded free from Moncloa to Princesa - Magical Madrid”
Reviews.Author: GRPSWFC
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Moncloa, the Princesa's sister hotel on 22nd Jan and were upgraded to the Princesa. A wonderful start!! It was in a great location and the staff were very ffirendly and helpful. The rooms had 2 double beds and a marble bathroom. It was a Wi-Fi zone also, not that I had time to use my laptop as Madrid was magic and there was so much to do. We enjoyed room service one night following a full day and night out and the food was excellent. Great value, great location, great trip. I booked via Venere.com and their service was exceptional too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Wandring_star
Reviews.Content: We were actually upgraded to this hotel from the Husa Moncloa which is next door. I do not have much experience of 5 * hotels, but this was very nice. The rooms were large and very well equipped. The location was fabulous, right next to the 'El Corte ingles' department store, near lots of other shops, with a Metro station just around the corner. I thought the buffet breakfast was great with lots of choice and very good quality. The staff were friendly We paid to eat lunch in the Global cafe one day, and this was decidely average, particularly at 12 Euros for a sandwich. The Gym did not open until 10 in the morning which was inconvenient for those of us who like a workout to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: trip4u2
Reviews.Content: We also stayed here for 3 nights in Sept. as one of the hotels on a Globus tour (maybe the same tour as the previous reviewer was on). The staff was friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was average, not great, but I'm not big on buffets anyway. We did not have other meals here so cannot comment on the dining room for lunch/dinner. As for the rooms, the one we were in was like a suite w/sofa & chair for sitting area. Very comfortable, clean, and quiet. Nice large bathroom. The hotel location is great. A short walk to the Royal Palace which, by the way, I highly recommend seeing. We also walked to the Prado museum and the Plaza Mayor, although these were much longer walks; not bad if you like to get out and see the city up close. By American standards, I would rate this hotel a 4/5 star, about like a Marriott or Westin. It worked out great for our tour but can't comment if you were to book and stay on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: feliciah7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as part of a Globus tour. The rooms in the hotel are nice, and above average in size. Breakfast was included in the price of the room, so I can't complain too much about it. It seems that the staff does their best to cater to English and American taste buds, while adding a couple of Spanish delicacies. It was explained to me that the Spanish don't eat heavy breakfasts (as Americans are accustomed to). Therefore, I think their attempts were adequate. The concierge spoke great English, but the rest of the staff gave me a great opportunity to practice my Spanish. I found that most people do speak passable English, and tend to be a bit more forgiving if you at least try to communicate in their language vs. expecting them to speak English right off the bat. The hotel is in an excellent location: just steps from El Corte Ingles, which is a Macy's type department store. There are several branches near the hotel. The main one has a grocery store in the basement. Across the street are a furniture store and book store. The hotel is also walking distance from several restaurants and tourist attractions. I highly recommend this hotel, but also recommend taking a pocket dictionary with you.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with absolutly horrible staff and services”
Reviews.Author: CorinnaS
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days at the Husa Princesa. Upon arrival and after showing our reservation via hotels. com the receptionist looked at us with a face saying: only hotels.com guests! He then asked us if we would like a smoking or non smoking room. We said non-smoking and when we entered the room the smell of smoke was so terrible that we could not believe it. I wanted to complain, but then we saw that in the ashtrays of the room there were non.smoking signs. A big joke! I asked at the reception to please open a window because the smell was absolutly terrible. When we came back after dinner the window was still closed. Fantastic. The next morning I asked the maid and she immediatly opened it. In the coffee shop you get the feeling upon entering, that you are molesting the waiters. They look at you but they do not come and ask you what you would like to have. As if they are waiting that you get bored and leave. What we did. The prices at the bar are just amazing. One beer 6 Euros, one water 6 euros. They close the terrace whilst there are several tables occupied at midnight. If you do not get up, they tell you to do so.! For a five star hotel and being in Madrid where peolpe start having dinner at 10.00 this is just impossible. We can only recommend not to book a room in this hotel. It is a real ripp off. P.S.- Two coffees, two toasts , one bottle of water and an orange juice 20 Euros. Just opposite there is a coffee shop where we had the same and much better for Euros 5,85.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good but not Five Stars”
Reviews.Author: tlan_11
Reviews.Content: If you can get a good rate for the hotel, it's a pretty good choice.
