The rooms are nice and mine was really large (as most others seem to be) with the overall feel of the hotel seeming more like 4 than 5 stars. The staff is polite but not particularly friendly and when asked for suggestions (restaurants, sites,...) they came through. The location is good in that it's in the main shopping district and close to the royal palace. Also, it's a few blocks from a bus station which is convenient for day trips outside of Madrid (one bus to Escorial). However, if your intention is to go to the museum triangle including the Prado, you will need to take a subway but this only takes about 15-20 min total. Also, great parks and some good restaurants located close by. The neighbourhood is very safe with lots of people around at night. The breakfast is nothing special but fine if included with the rate. As with most other hotels, everything extra is very expensive (laundry, bar, restaurant,...).

Reviews.Title: “Most unfriendly hotel I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: FinolaDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: A group of eight women friends visited this hotel in March 2006. We booked it cos it looked great on the internet and we wanted to treat ourselves to a bit of 5 star luxury.However, from the moment we entered the hotel we encountered nothing but bad manners and rip off prices, e.g. a small glass of beer in the hotel lobby bar cost €6! as did a small glass on red wine. Breakfast was not included in the price but was available for €12.Not a great spread.Also, the hotel was that little bit out of town to go out at night. This was because there seemed to be a huge shortage of taxis in Madrid this particular weekend and although we tried on two of the nights to go to the city centre, we were unable to get a taxi so stayed locally.You would imagine that a 5 star hotel would have some kind of a taxi account. The bedroom we had was clean and comfortable,but the view from the bedroom was a big wall, the side of the Corte Ingles shopping centre! Also, the internet advertisement for this hotel stated that there were robes and slippers in the bedrooms, but there was only one robe and no slippers,not much good when there are two guests . Overall,I would class this as a three or four star hotel and the most unfriendly thatI have ever stayed in. Visitor from Dublin,Ireland

Reviews.Title: “not the best in town”
Reviews.Author: fipol
Reviews.Content: I just come back home from a 2 nights at the Husa Princesa and feel like to leave my impression on my stay: Reception staff was nothing exciting.....check in was much more like posting a mail at the post office than entering your temporary "home" in a foreign country. Voucher, sign and credit card were the only three words that came out from the reception man. Room #802: good size was the only real positive point, loud and malfunctioning heating, malfunctioning window, pay-tv not working. The bathroom ceiling needed to be repaired and painted. Housekeeping will knock on your door and open it every 15 mins till you wake up and go out if you don't hang something out of the door! Breakfast is ok even if I would have expected something more on the buffet. Would I reccomend it? NO Would I stay there again? NO

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the Dishonest Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: HKJR
Reviews.Content: Three of us, coming from different places at time, all had credit card guaranteed (in black and white) confirmations for our rooms. Two of us checked in and got rooms by 7PM. At 8PM, obviously due to overbooking, the last of us to arrive was told that his reservation had been "cancelled". This was of course not true and just a lie from the staff to cover up the overbooking. A virgourous argument ensued and the staff refused to give their names, even took off their name tags, refused to call a duty manager, claiming there was none even 'if the hotel burned down". Bottom line is the service quality here stinks, the staff are dishonest, and customers get screwed ( we saw another 5 or 6 groups turned way with confirmed bookings like us whose reservations were 'cancelled'. THIS IS AN "AVOID AT ALL COST" HOTEL , MADRID HAS ENOUGH OTHER HOTELS WITH HONEST STAFF that deserve your business !
